alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Morris, central Somerset and north central Middlesex Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Somerville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, Bridgewater, Middlesex, Bound Brook, Manville, Millstone, Martinsville, Millington, Society Hill, North Brunswick Township, South Plainfield, North Plainfield, Highland Park, Metuchen, Dunellen and Raritan. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 10. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 43. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
